chapter.title: Search Paths 2
chapter.para: By clicking on a folder, you produce the path leading to the folder in the search panel (visible in the "inside" field). To search inside this path, enter a search term in the "Search for" field. The system then shows all search hits found inside this path. To show all records inside a folder, leave the "Search for" field empty. Double-clicking on a folder has the same effect. In the below example, you have chosen the folder "Cluster Publications", so the path leads from the base folder, "resources", to the folder "commons" and then to the folder "Cluster Publications".
The folder called "commons" is used for all Cluster resources that are not assigned to specific users or groups.
When you have selected a folder, the search is performed in this folder and its subfolders.
You can only search in one folder (and its subfolders) at a time.
